jto.p5graphtheory

Class Edge

  • java.lang.Object
    • jto.p5graphtheory.Edge
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Edge>

    public class Edge
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Edge>
    This is the Edge class.

    This class models an undirected edge for a graph. The edge has two vertices and a length. The length is the Euclidean distance between the two vertices of the Edge. Edges are sorted by length using the comparable interface.
    To associate a different cost to the edge (other than length) you can use the setCost() method, which will overwrite the length field with the new cost.

    NOTE: These are undirected edges, meaning that an edge with vertices {a, b} is the same as an edge with vertices {b, a}.
    Version:
    2012.08.13
    Author:
    J. Taylor O'Connor

      • getLength

        public float getLength()
        Returns the length of the edge. If a cost has been set using setCost(), then this returns the cost instead of the length.
        Returns:
        The length or cost of the edge.

      • isIncidentTo

        public boolean isIncidentTo(Vertex v)
        Tests whether this Edge is incident to the given Vertex.
        Parameters:
        v - the Vertex to be tested.
        Returns:
        True if the Vertex is incident to this Edge.

      • setCost

        public void setCost(float cost)
        This allows you to associate a cost with the edge. The default cost is the length of the edge, which is the Euclidean distance between the edge's two vertices.

        Setting a cost will overwrite the length field, and the Edge will use this cost in comparisons with other Edges.
        Parameters:
        cost - the new cost for the edge.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Edge otherEdge)
        This is the method inhereted from the Comparable interface. This compares the length of this Edge to the length of the other Edge.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Edge>
        Parameters:
        otherEdge - the other Edge to compare with this one.
        Returns:
        -1 if this Edge is shorter than the other Edge, 1 if this Edge is longer, and 0 if the two Edges are the same length.
